result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Rowton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid during term of sentence. Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge. If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time as approved by the agent.
Comply with any treatment recommendations, including anger management and psychological counseling as recommended by agent.

Take all medications as prescribed.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Dept of Corrections.
Sign releases of information forms for offender's assessments, medications/pharmacies and treatment.
Provide DNA Sample for testing if not already submitted.
No contact with T Griffith unless she wishes to have such contact and approved by the agent.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael R Rowton in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll. Defendant Michael R Rowton in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-233, 16CF-158 and 15CM-217.

9:01 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Constable states appearances.

This matter is set for a sentencing this morning.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

There is a victim present (15CF-233) but does not wish to make a statement.

Court ordered a PSI to be completed on 15CF-233. Court received a copy of the PSI, copies were forwarded copies.

State received their copy, states a correction on page 26. Atty Carroll has no objection.

Atty Carroll has reviewed the PSI with his client, has no additions/corrections/deletions to state.

There is no reason why the Court shouldn't go to sentencing today.

Atty Constable addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Atty Carroll addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court reviews the files. Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.
Court reviews the PSI and competency report. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF-233:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 3.5 years
Initial Confinement for 1.5 years
Extended Supervision 2 years
Not eligible for challenge incarceration program
Not eligible for substance abuse program
Conditions:
Comply with any treatment recommendations, including anger management and psychological counseling as recommended by agent
Take all medications as prescribed
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Dept of Corrections
Sign releases of information forms for offender's assessments, medications/pharmacies and treatment
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time as approved by the agent
Provide DNA Sample for testing if not already submitted
No contact with T Griffith unless she wishes to have such contact and approved by the agent
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
To be paid during term of sentence

15CM-217:
Count 1:
6 month term of inprisonment consecutive to 15CF-233
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Pay costs
178 days credit

Count 2:
90 days jail concurrent to Count 1 
Pay costs
178 days credit

16CF-158:
Count 2:
Jail sentence for 6 months concurrent to 15CM-217 but consecutive to 15CF-233
98 days credit
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 3:
Jail sentence for 6 months concurrent to Count 2, concurrent to 15CM-217 but consecutive to 15CF-233
98 days credit
Pay costs

All costs and surcharges may be taken out at 25% of prison account.
Court encourages the prison intake to  complete a thorough mental health assessment.

Written explanation of determinate sentence is completed, copy will be provided to Defendant.

Appeal rights are addressed. 20 days in which to appeal or not.
Sentencing hearing on July 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

11:34 a.m. Defendant Michael R Rowton in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll. Defendant Michael R Rowton in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Counts 2 & 3 No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 2 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Counts 1 and 4 are dismissed and read in.

BY THE COURT:***15CF233, 15CM217, and 16CF158 are to be set for sentencing together on 07-20-16 at 9:00 a.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on August 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on June 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 06-02-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Michael R Rowton in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-217 and 15CF-233.

1:32 PM Court calls cases.
Matters are set for a sentencing at this time.

Atty Constable states appearances.

A plea was entered in 15CM-217 previously.

There is a request for a continuance.

Atty Carroll is requesting the matters be adjourned.  Atty Carroll received a copy of the PSI in Monday's mail, has not had time to review the report with his client. Atty Carroll requests the Defense to prepare their own PSI.

Atty Constable addresses the Court, has spoken with victim in 15CM-217, victim doesn't have a problem with matter being continued to a later date.

Atty Constable has not spoken with officer regarding 15CF-233.

Atty Constable agreed not to exceed the recommendation of the PSI.

BY THE COURT:
Court grants adjournment.

Parties discuss dates.

Atty Carroll has not had a defense PSI prepared before, requests more time to have one prepared.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

10:32  a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.

Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant is withdrawing his request to dismiss his attorney.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF233:
Count 1 - No contest 

15CM217:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:

Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1 & 2 in 15CM217 and Count 1 in 15CF233.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Court questions Defendant's attorney.
